meanings.definition: Voices - sounds uttered by the mouth for speaking, singing, etc.
meanings.sent1: Her voces filled the room with beautiful music.
meanings.sent2: The choir harmonized their voces during the performance.
meanings.sent3: The voces of the birds outside made her smile.
meanings.sent4: His voces echoed through the empty hall, haunting and melodic.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's strong voces captivated the students' attention.

meanings.definition: Voices - opinions or beliefs expressed by a group of people
meanings.sent1: The voces of the community were heard at the town hall meeting.
meanings.sent2: Different political parties have conflicting voces on this issue.
meanings.sent3: Her voces on fashion always spark interesting debates.
meanings.sent4: The voces of the past generations still resonate in our society today.
meanings.sent5: The voces of the protesters grew louder as they marched down the street.

meanings.definition: Voices - the ability to produce sound using the vocal cords
meanings.sent1: His strong voces allowed him to project his speech clearly.
meanings.sent2: Singers need to take care of their voces to maintain their vocal range.
meanings.sent3: The parrot's mimicry of human voces always amused the guests.
meanings.sent4: Her voces were like a musical instrument, hitting every note perfectly.
meanings.sent5: The actor's versatile voces brought life to various characters on stage.
